bug.author: SamuelJoutard
bug.summary: Problem when creating a Dataloader from a torchio.ImagesDataset
bug.description:
üêõBug Hi, I recently updated my torchio version to the latest one (0.17.0) and there seems to be some problems when creating Dataloader from torchio.ImagesDataset objects. In my case, the following code works well in 0.16.0 but fails under torchio 0.17.0. To reproduce path_data = "Data/preprocessed_data" train_list = ["07"] path_lbl_m = os.path.join(os.path.join(path_data, "label"), "label00"+train_list[0]+".nii.gz") path_im_m = os.path.join(os.path.join(path_data, "img"), "img00"+train_list[0]+".nii.gz") subj_list = [torchio.Subject(label=torchio.Image(path_lbl_m, torchio.LABEL), img=torchio.Image(path_im_m, torchio.INTENSITY))] dataset = torchio.ImagesDataset(subj_list) print(dataset[0]["img"]["data"].shape) print(dataset[0]["label"]["data"].shape)
DL = DataLoader(dataset, batch_size=1, shuffle=True) for b in DL: print(b["img"][torchio.DATA]) print(b["label"][torchio.DATA]) torch.Size([1, 348, 272, 108]) torch.Size([1, 348, 272, 108]) Traceback (most recent call last): File "Code/non_local_feature_alignment/dataset_manager.py", line 88, in <module> print(b["img"][torchio.DATA]) KeyError: 'data' Expected behavior TorchIO version

comments.comment:
Hi Sam, Thanks for reporting, I can reproduce. This was introduced in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fepegar/torchio/pull/204>#204</denchmark-link> . This is the code I'm using to reproduce: import torchio from torch.utils.data import DataLoader
subj_list = [torchio.datasets.Colin27()] dataset = torchio.ImagesDataset(subj_list) print(dataset[0]['t1'][torchio.DATA].shape) print(dataset[0]['brain'][torchio.DATA].shape)
loader = DataLoader(dataset, batch_size=1, shuffle=True) for batch in loader: print(batch['t1'][torchio.DATA]) print(batch['brain'][torchio.DATA])

Fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fepegar/torchio/pull/210>#210</denchmark-link>
Should work in v0.17.2.
